thread.title: Jaguar Land Rover to test self-driving valet parking on Britain's streets

title: Jaguar Land Rover to test self-driving valet parking on Britain's streets
text: March 22, 2018 / 12:40 AM / Updated 29 minutes ago Jaguar Land Rover to test self-driving valet parking on Britain's streets Reuters Staff 2 Min Read LONDON (Reuters) - Britain’s biggest carmaker Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) ( TAMO.NS ) was showcasing self-driving valet technology on Britain’s streets on Thursday which allows a car to find a space and park itself. The logo of Jaguar is seen during the 88th International Motor Show at Palexpo in Geneva, Switzerland, March 6, 2018. REUTERS/Pierre Albouy The firm’s Range Rover Sport will also travel on open public roads at up to 30 miles per hour, as carmakers compete with each other and burgeoning technology companies like Google ( GOOGL.O ) to deliver the latest advancements to drivers. “Reducing the everyday stresses of driving - like squeezing into a tight parking place - means that we can all focus on the more enjoyable aspects of our cars,” said Joerg Schlinkheider, Jaguar Land Rover Chief Engineer, Automated Driving. JLR will also showcase technology which alerts drivers when an emergency vehicle is approaching and notifies motorists when another connected car brakes, helping to potentially avoid accidents. The tests will take place in the central English town of Milton Keynes. In a potential blow to the technology expected to transform transportation worldwide, an Uber self-driving car hit   Arizona, police said on Monday. Reporting by Costas Pitas; editing by Stephen Addison
